problem: A cuboid has dimensions of 4 cm, 5 cm, and 6 cm. If the longest side is doubled in length, what is the new volume of the cuboid?
solution: The original volume of the cuboid is $V = 4 \times 5 \times 6 = 120$ cubic cm. Doubling the longest side gives the new dimensions as 4 cm, 5 cm, and 12 cm. The new volume is $V_{new} = 4 \times 5 \times 12 = 240$ cubic cm. \(\boxed{240}\)
